frameDefinitions: A Wearer puts on an item of Clothing, which then occupies the Body_location.
A Host is judged regarding their attitude as a potential host in a guest-host relationship.
An Excreter excretes Excreta. 'Principal Skinner burped on me.'
A Wearer removes an item of Clothing from a Body_location (the part of the body that the Clothing is prototypically worn on.)
An Agent is performing the portion of an Activity in which there is dynamic stability. '' 'Not noticing the hoards of people rushing by the window, Manny continued eating his lunch.'
Unless a particular Required_situation obtains, Negative_consequences will follow.
frameExamples: You didn't have to <t>dress</t> like a pirate to impress me. INI
I found the board to be very <t>hospitable</t> to Russian graduates.
Walking on sand is better if you <t>take</t> <t>off</t> your shoes. INI
Not noticing the hoards of people rushing by the window, Manny <t>continued</t> eating his lunch.
You <t>must</t> turn in your test by 5 p.m.
listRoleDefinitions: The individual that puts <fen>Clothing</fen> on their body.
<fen>Clothing</fen> is used for the item of clothing that the <fen>Wearer</fen> ends up wearing.
The time when the <fen>Wearer</fen> puts an item of <fen>Clothing</fen> on.
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the Donning occurs.
The <fen>Host</fen> is the person whose <fen>Behavior</fen> towards others as a (potential) host is evaluated.
The <fen>Guest</fen> is the entity which is positively or negatively treated by the <fen>Host</fen>.
The <fen>Behavior</fen> is the action of the <fen>Host</fen> on which the evaluation of the <fen>Host</fen>'s character is based.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the situation or person that the <fen>Host</fen>'s <fen>Behavior</fen> responds to or is related to.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Host</fen>.
The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the evaluation.
The <fen>Excreta</fen> is the waste expelled by the body.
The <fen>Excreter</fen> is the agent who excretes the <fen>Excreta</fen>.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the starting point of the <fen>Excreta</fen>'s motion.
When the <fen>Excreter</fen> engages in excretion.
This role identifieis the <fen>Place</fen> where the excretion occurs.
The individual who begins the action wearing the <fen>Clothing</fen> and ends the action without it.
The item that the <fen>Wearer</fen> is initially wearing but then removes.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which a <fen>Wearer</fen> undresses.
The location at which the <fen>Wearer</fen> undresses an item of <fen>Clothing</fen>.

Duration denotes the length of <fen>Time</fen> from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.
This role identifies the name of the ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> in which an <fen>Agent</fen> engages.
The <fen>Agent</fen> engages in an ongoing <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when an ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
The state-of-affairs which prevents <fen>Negative_consequences</fen>.
The period during which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is necessary to prevent negative consequences.
The location within which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is required.
listRoleExamples: She had put the dress on <fex>this morning</fex> expecting it to be sunny.
Dr. Nick vomited <fex>puke</fex> across the table.
<fex>The suspects</fex> had to strip publically and endure several blasts from a firehose.
He was told that <fex>when he got back</fex> , his column needed a serious rethink .
<fex>In California</fex> , seatbelts must be fastened at all times .

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Facts and Observations Obtained During Ten Days' Experience
Eyewitness of the Brutal and Barbarous Treatment by the Guerrillas of the Dead, Wounded, and Captured of Major Johnston's Command
